Your settlement has crumbled to its end..string: Ваше поселення дожило до свого кінця.

Your fortress has settled into the rhyth.string: Ваша фортеця ввійшла в ритм повсякденного життя, за межами вашої копіткої турботи.

[P]You have arrived. After a journey fr.string:
[P]Ви прибули. Ваша мандрівка з Гірських домів у
загрозливу цілину позаду, і ваша важка дорога нарешті
скінчилася. Ваша ватага із семи осіб має заснувати
поселення на славу всього [VAR:NATIVENAME:GLOBAL:YOURCIV].

[P]There are almost no supplies left, bu.string:
[P]Припасів майже не лишилося,але з міцною працею
приходить прожиток.Хоч болтом,хоч плугом чи гаком забезпечуйте
своїх гномів. Ви чекаєте на караван припасів прямо перед тим,
як зима поховає Вас,але зараз весна.
Достатньо часу,аби побудувати захищені будинки,а також не [VAR:NAME_PLURAL:GLOBAL:LOCAL_LARGE_PREDATOR]померти голодною смертю.
Нова глава історії гномів починається тут,
[VAR:NATIVENAME:GLOBAL:YOURFORT],
"[VAR:TRANSLATEDNAME:GLOBAL:YOURFORT]". Ударте землю!

[P]Your ruler has arrived with a full en.string: [P]Ваш правитель прибув із великим почетом. Відтепер ви - Гірський дім.

[P]Although it is a grim reminder of the.string:
[P]Незважаючи на похмуре нагадування про зимові негаразди,щоб прибути
Караван з припасами з [VAR:NATIVENAME:GLOBAL:YOURCIV]-приємне видовище.
Коли торговці вигружають їхнє добро у депо,
ви помічаєте завзяття у їхніх очах,
з яким вони готуються до перевірки
прекрасних продуктів вашої індустрії
Зверніть увагу на запаси ваших магазинів.Запропоновоне цими гномами добро
може привести як до процвітаючого майбутнього,
так і до повільної,безглуздої смерті.

[P]You have returned. How have your stu.string: [P]You have returned.  How have your sturdy charges fared in your absence?  Have they gone on adventures or moved on to richer delving at new frontier settlements?  Perhaps they are all still here, unwilling to leave the magnificent fortress you prepared for them.   Deep underground, the promise of treasure and the thrill of overcoming danger have lured you back to this place.  Will you strike the earth again?

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: I am yo.string: [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Я - ваш зв'язок із Гірськими домами. Обговорімо ваше становище!

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: Farewel.string:
[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Farewell, [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:NOBLE].  I look forward
to our meeting next year.  Our fortunes rise and fall together.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: You hav.string:
[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  You have disrespected the trees in this area, but this is what we have come to expect
from your stunted kind.  Further abuse cannot be tolerated.  Let this be a warning to you.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: What a.string:
[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  What a pleasant surprise!  Not a single tree here weeps from the abuses
meted out with such ease by your people.  Joy!  The dwarves have turned a page,
not that we would make paper.  A travesty!  Perhaps it is better said that the dwarves
have turned over a new leaf, and the springtime for our two races has
only just begun.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: Greetin.string: [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Greetings from the woodlands.  We have much to discuss.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: Althoug.string:
[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Although we do not always see eye to eye (ha!), I
bid you farewell.  May you someday embrace nature as you embrace the rocks and mud.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: Greetin.string: [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Greetings, noble dwarf.  There is much to discuss.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: It has.string:
[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  It has been an honor, noble [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:NOBLE].
I bid you farewell.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: On beha.string: [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  On behalf of the Merchants' Guild, let me extend greetings to your people.  There is much to discuss.

[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]: Again o.string:
[VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Again on behalf of the Merchants' Guild, let me bid farewell
to you and your stout dwarves.

Before you begin, you need to create you.string: Before you begin, you need to create your adventurer.

First, you choose from among the availab.string: First, you choose from among the available human, dwarf and elf civilizations or choose a retired adventurer once you have one.  New adventurers also pick a status from among peasant, hero and demigod.  The only effect of this status is to determine how powerful your character is at the beginning of the game.  The status will be indicated in your introduction in legends mode.

Second, you need to select attributes an.string: Second, you need to select attributes and skills to improve.  Among skills, most of the mental ones have no use in adventure mode currently, but kinesthetic sense and spatial sense can be used in combat.  Fighter and Observer are useful skills for combat.  Fighter influences your aiming chances greatly, relatively to your opponent's skill.  Your weapon skill will determine your starting equipment.  In the final screen you can select a name and gender for yourself.

Unless your world was somehow catastroph.string: Unless your world was somehow catastrophically depopulated, you should start in an appropriate settlement.  Feel free to explore, but in order to give yourself some direction, you can talk ([IKEY:A_TALK]) to people to get information and recruit followers.  The number and quality of the people that will join you depends on your overall skill and reputation.  You can ask people in town for numerous tasks at a time, though you might want to avoid this to reduce clutter in your log.  If somebody refers you elsewhere for a task, you can still ask for tasks again to obtain any additional tasks that person is interested in mentioning.

Once you are ready to go, you can press.string: Once you are ready to go, you can press [IKEY:A_TRAVEL] (in friendly locations).  This takes you to the travel map, where you can move more quickly to your destination.  View your adventurer log ([IKEY:A_LOG]) to help you locate sites you know about or to remind you of your tasks.  You cannot enter certain sites from the travel map.  Stop travel ([IKEY:A_END_TRAVEL]) from the outskirts to approach these places carefully.

You'll need to eat and drink. You start.string: You'll need to eat and drink.  You start with some water, and you can refill your waterskin at a river or well.  Food is sold in town and you can also butcher animals that you kill in the wilderness.  It is important to stay well-rested, but it is dangerous to sleep outside, especially at night.  Travel with others or obtain permission to sleep in cottages or castles for the night.

If you cannot make use of the objects yo.string: If you cannot make use of the objects you find, remember that you can still sell them at towns and obtain more useful ones there.  There are many currencies in use in the world, and you may find that you have to trade in some types of coins as regular objects.  This devalues them significantly at this time.

Remember to check the key bindings to se.string: Remember to check the key bindings to see a list of your options.  There are many commands that were not described here.

Icons are exactly as in the main game, e.string: Icons are exactly as in the main game, except that @ is reserved for you.

Maybe you attempted to guide the dwarves.string:
Maybe you attempted to guide the dwarves to fortune and things just didn't work out?
Welcome to adventure mode.  Now you'll create a character and go on a journey of
discovery throughout the world your dwarves left behind.  Perhaps you'll set out for
the ruins of your old fortress or help a nearby town.  Throughout the course
of your explorations, you'll not only build your own legend, but unearth tales of
ancient heroes and fallen civilizations (possibly your own).  Whether you are in it for personal glory,
or so that the legend of your dwarf fortress can be exposed to the scrutiny of history, you'll
find what you're looking for...  or die trying several times.

Here are the keys you can use to control.string: Here are the keys you can use to control your adventurer.

[IKEY:A_CARE_MOVE_S] etc. - Move careful.string: [IKEY:A_CARE_MOVE_S] etc. - Move carefully (for entering water, jumping off cliffs).

[IKEY:A_WAIT] - Wait for ten instants (a.string: [IKEY:A_WAIT] - Wait for ten instants (a normal step).

[IKEY:A_HOLD] - Hold or hang from someth.string: [IKEY:A_HOLD] - Hold or hang from something (to climb).  Mount/dismount/lead/claim pet.

[IKEY:A_JUMP] - Jump. Sprint in movemen.string: [IKEY:A_JUMP] - Jump.  Sprint in movement options to run and jump.

[IKEY:A_INV_PUTIN] - Put an item in a co.string: [IKEY:A_INV_PUTIN] - Put an item in a container, place an item on or in furniture, or pack an item on a pack animal.

[IKEY:A_INV_REMOVE] - Remove an item you.string: [IKEY:A_INV_REMOVE] - Remove an item you are wearing or from a container.

[IKEY:A_BUILDING] - Interact with a buil.string: [IKEY:A_BUILDING] - Interact with a building, furniture, vehicle or mechanism.

[IKEY:A_ACTION] - Create an object, crea.string: [IKEY:A_ACTION] - Create an object, create art, use powers, or butcher a corpse.

[IKEY:A_INTERACT] - Interact with an obj.string: [IKEY:A_INTERACT] - Interact with an object in an advanced way.

[IKEY:A_SEARCH] - Search the nearby area.string: [IKEY:A_SEARCH] - Search the nearby area very carefully.

[IKEY:A_DISPLAY_TRACKS] - Display all ne.string: [IKEY:A_DISPLAY_TRACKS] - Display all nearby tracks and strongest odor.

You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for h.string: You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for help.  Press it now for help on how to use this text viewer.  And remember:

[C:2:0:1]Losing is still fun, and now it.string: [C:2:0:1]Losing is still fun, and now it's personal![C:7:0:0]

Once you get a baron, your dwarves will.string: Once you get a baron, your dwarves will all be given accounts in the currency of the dwarven kingdom.

They can no longer freely acquire goods,.string:
They can no longer freely acquire goods, or even food, but instead must purchase these things.  The only exception is that penniless starving
dwarves can eat the cheapest food items in the fortress.

Nobles do not have accounts. Dwarves th.string: Nobles do not have accounts.  Dwarves that have attained a legendary skill status are also exempt.

Other dwarves must obtain money by doing.string: Other dwarves must obtain money by doing tasks or running shops.

Once accounts are active, dwarves will w.string:
Once accounts are active, dwarves will want shiny coins to reflect their balances.  The bookkeeper sets mandates that let you know how many coins to make.
These mandates are exceptional in that there are no punishments associated to them.  Dwarves will periodically bring coins to their rooms or give
up coins if they have too many.

In order to sell goods to your dwarves,.string:
In order to sell goods to your dwarves, you'll have to set up shops.  Initially, shops are run by the bookkeeper and broker, but these dwarves
will attempt to sell the shops off to any willing buyer.

The shopkeeper buys finished goods from.string: The shopkeeper buys finished goods from the fortress stockpiles and has them moved to the stop to be sold to other dwarves at a slight profit.

All purchases occur at the account level.string:
All purchases occur at the account level.  Coins are not needed.  The bookkeeper handles all of the accounting.  All dwarves have exceptional
abilities with coin counting and seem to know the balances of every dwarf in the fortress, so there are no attempts to cheat the shopkeeper.

The power of Dwarven Justice dissuades p.string: The power of Dwarven Justice dissuades potential thieves.

When viewing building tasks or items, th.string: When viewing building tasks or items, the amount of clutter is displayed at the top right of the menu.  Clutter is caused by items in the building.

[C:0:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:0:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by two times.[R]

[C:7:0:0](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:7:0:0](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by three times.[R]

[C:7:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:7:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by four times.[R]

[C:6:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:6:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by five times.[R]

[C:4:0:0](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:4:0:0](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by six times.[R]

[C:4:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:4:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by seven times.[R]

[C:5:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:5:0:1](CLT)[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by eight times.[R]

[C:5:0:1]*CLT*[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed b.string: [C:5:0:1]*CLT*[C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by nine times.[R]

[C:5:0:1][CHAR:15]CLT[CHAR:15][C:7:0:0].string: [C:5:0:1][CHAR:15]CLT[CHAR:15][C:7:0:0] Work is slowed by ten times.[R]

In order to reduce clutter, you must rem.string: In order to reduce clutter, you must remove items from the building.  You can do this by storing them properly.

To the dwarves, all of this mining is po.string:
To the dwarves, all of this mining is pointless unless the end result is a fortress filled with treasure.
Once you've mined out some stone, you'll be ready to make crafts.  You can also make objects out of wood,
bone, shell, glass, silk... whatever your dwarves can get their hands on.  You can also decorate existing objects
with these materials.

In order to make crafts, you need the fo.string: In order to make crafts, you need the following:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, unoccupied dwarf with the proper profession

For technical help with these matters, f.string: For technical help with these matters, follow these links:

Now let's discuss the individual materia.string: Now let's discuss the individual materials.

Stone is simple. Use the mason or craft.string: Stone is simple.  Use the mason or craftsdwarf's workshop to assign jobs.  Stone is buried under a few layers of soil in low-lying areas, so dig downward if you have trouble finding some.

Certain varieties of stone, like limesto.string: Certain varieties of stone, like limestone, are used to further operations at the smelter.  If you want to use these in jobs, you'll have to enable them from the Stone Restriction screen.

Metal is more valuable than stone, but a.string:
Metal is more valuable than stone, but also harder to find and process.  The ore that you find must
be refined at a smelter.  Then you will have bars.  Bars can be made into objects at the metalsmith's forge.

These processes require fuel. You can u.string: These processes require fuel.  You can use charcoal made from wood, or coal fuel from coal refined from the mountain.

A metalsmith's forge requires an anvil..string: A metalsmith's forge requires an anvil.  You can either bring one with you or request one from the outpost liaison and trade for it the next year.

Gems are rare and valuable. When you mi.string:
Gems are rare and valuable.  When you mine them from the mountain, they are initially "rough".  Rough gems are unfinished stones
that need to be cut by a jeweler.  Build a jeweler's workshop to assign these jobs.

Rarely, the gem cutter will be inspired.string:
Rarely, the gem cutter will be inspired and make
a large finished gem or gem crafts.  Most of the time, you'll obtain small gems.  These objects are valuable in their own right, but can also be used to encrust other objects.

Wood is easy to obtain and requires no p.string:
Wood is easy to obtain and requires no processing.  It is also an early source of fuel and can be used to make lye.
Cut wood by designating trees for logging outside.  You can then use the logs at the carpenter's workshop, the bowyer's workshop and
the wood furnace.  Keep in mind that wood is the only material that can be used for beds and axles, so it's good to keep
a steady supply of logs coming in from outdoors.

Bone and shell are the debris of eating.string:
Bone and shell are the debris of eating and butchery, but they can be used to make crafts or enhance existing objects as well.  This work
is done at the craftsdwarf's workshop.

Raw skins are obtained from the butcher'.string:
Raw skins are obtained from the butcher's shop any time a corpse is butchered, and these can be processed at the tanner's workshop to make leather.
The butcher and tanner assign jobs automatically.

Leather can then be used to make clothin.string:
Leather can then be used to make clothing, armor, backpacks, quivers, bags and crafts.
Soldiers use backpacks to hold food so that they can stay on duty longer.  The value of leather depends on the creature.

Cloth is made at a loom from thread. Th.string:
Cloth is made at a loom from thread.  Thread is obtained from plants which have been processed at the farmer's workshop.  Cloth can be used at the
clothes maker's shop to create clothes, crafts or bags.

Silk is like the cloth made from plant,.string:
Silk is like the cloth made from plant, but generally more valuable.  You'll occasionally find webs in your fortress, and if you have a loom,
a task will appear automatically which lets the dwarves collect these webs.  Once you have silk cloth from the loom, you can use it like standard
cloths.

Glass is a fairly valuable material and.string: Glass is a fairly valuable material and can be a decent early trade good.  If you have a bag, you can create an order to collect sand at a glass furnace.

In order to collect sand, you need to cr.string: In order to collect sand, you need to create a sand collection activity zone.

Using sand, you can create green glass g.string:
Using sand, you can create green glass goods at the glass furnace.  Green glass isn't very valuable, but if you also have pearlash, you can make clear glass.
Pearlash is potash which has been baked in a kiln.  As described in the paragraph on fertilizing farms, potash is obtained by evaporating
lye water, and lye water is obtained from soaking wood ash at the ashery.

You can also substitute sand with rock c.string: You can also substitute sand with rock crystal in the clear glass recipe to make crystal glass, which is quite valuable.

Soap is a fairly valuable commodity, but.string:
Soap is a fairly valuable commodity, but its creation is somewhat involved.
You need to create a soap maker's workshop, as well as lye and some rendered fat.  The value of soap depends on the creature.
Unrotten fat can be rendered in the kitchen.

You have two main methods of defending y.string: You have two main methods of defending yourself:  soldiers and traps.

At any time, any dwarf that isn't a nobl.string:
At any time, any dwarf that isn't a noble or a child can be recruited for service.
This is done from the military screen, where the dwarves can be organized into squads.

Dwarves with no weapon skills do not lik.string: Dwarves with no weapon skills do not like being drafted, and dwarves with no craft skills do not like being relieved.

Dwarves do not like serving on active du.string: Dwarves do not like serving on active duty for long periods of time.  Use the schedule options in the military screen to relieve squads for a time.  Squads that are standing down will train if you have a barracks or archery targets.

Traps are another effective method of th.string:
Traps are another effective method of thwarting your opposition.  These come in many forms.  The components required
depend on the trap, but all traps need mechanisms.  You can link levers and pressure plates to certain furniture to
trigger more elaborate traps.

Dwarves like to eat, and there are many.string:
Dwarves like to eat, and there are many ways to serve them their favorite dishes. These include
gathering plants, fishing, hunting, butchering livestock and farming.

Gathering plants is a fairly inefficient.string:
Gathering plants is a fairly inefficient way to get food, but you'll have to do it sometimes, if
only to get seeds that you can use for farming later.  In order to gather plants you need:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, unoccupied dwarf with the Plant Gathering profession

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A bush in a.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A bush in a designated plant gathering area that such a dwarf can access

Fishing is a fairly easy way to get some.string:
Fishing is a fairly easy way to get some initial food, but you'll find yourself running out of fish in larger fortresses.
In order to fish you need:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, unoccupied dwarf with the Fishing profession

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A nearby wat.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A nearby water source or a fishing activity zone

Fish need to be cleaned after you catch.string: Fish need to be cleaned after you catch them.  You'll need to construct a fishery to do this.

Hunting is another way to get some initi.string:
Hunting is another way to get some initial food, but it will put the life of your hunter at risk.
In order to hunt you need:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, unoccupied dwarf with the Hunting profession, preferably armed with a ranged weapon

For technical help with these matters, f.string: For technical help with these matters, follow this link:

You can slaughter animals that aren't pe.string:
You can slaughter animals that aren't pets, and you can butcher any animal corpse that doesn't belong to a pet.
In order to butcher a corpse you need:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, unoccupied dwarf with the Butchery profession

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] An accessibl.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] An accessible unrotten animal corpse that wasn't once a pet

To slaughter animals, designate them for.string: To slaughter animals, designate them for slaughter from the Animals screen.

Farming is the most reliable way to obta.string:
Farming is the most reliable way to obtain food, but it is also the most complicated to prepare.
To get started, you must place a farm plot.  You can place a farm plot on soil or mud, inside or outside.
Dwarves with the Farming (Fields) profession will plant seeds according to your selections in the farm plot menu, and all dwarves help with the harvest.  A plant will generally grow either inside or outside, so be careful with the seeds you select.

Should you find a water source, you can.string:
Should you find a water source, you can divert the water using channels and floodgates to control
which squares become muddy (all water currently places mud).

Some plants that you farm aren't immedia.string:
Some plants that you farm aren't immediately edible, but can be processed at a mill or farmer's workshop to make
flour, sugar, syrup, spices or thread for cloth-making.

You can greatly increase your farm outpu.string:
You can greatly increase your farm output by using potash as a fertilizer.
Potash is obtained from evaporating lye water, and lye water is obtained from soaking wood ash.  These jobs
are carried out at the Ashery.  The Making Crafts section of the First Outpost tutorial will discuss how to assign jobs.

Each dwarf has preferred foods, but they.string:
Each dwarf has preferred foods, but they only eat one piece of food when they are hungry.  In order to maximize the chance that a dwarf can find
a piece of food that they really enjoy, it is important to use a kitchen to prepare food.  This mixes the food types together.  It also allows a dwarven
cook the opportunity to apply their craft to the ingredients and produce higher quality foods.  The Making Crafts section of the First Outpost tutorial covers job assignment.

Welcome to Dwarf Fortress. Prepare to g.string:
Welcome to Dwarf Fortress.  Prepare to guide your stout charges to fortune in a world fraught with many perils.
You'll begin by creating your world and watching an animation of the region's history.  Once this process
is completed, you can prepare a group of dwarves and send them out to seek wealth deep in the mountains.
As you dig deeper and more dwarves take up residence in your outpost, your doings will attract attention, both
wanted and unwanted.  Deal with challenges as they arise, and you might one day find that your fortress
has grown to become the capital of the kingdom.

Your dwarves don't like to sleep and eat.string:
Your dwarves don't like to sleep and eat outside in the mud and rain, so you'll like to set up some
living quarters early on.

If you build some beds and place them, t.string:
If you build some beds and place them, the dwarves will sleep in them when they are tired.  If you use the building interface
to create a bedroom, then the first dwarf to sleep in the room will claim it unless you assign a dwarf first.  The better the room,
the happier the dwarf, but regular workers don't expect much.  Keep your eyes on their thoughts to see how you are doing.

A dwarf expects a decent dining experien.string:
A dwarf expects a decent dining experience.  To keep the dwarves satisfied the bare minimum is a table with an adjacent chair.  You'll
know that you are doing this correctly because the dwarf will sit on the chair and you'll see the dwarf's meal placed on the table.  Dragging out
a dining room from the table will enhance the dining experience, but it is not required.

Another way to keep dwarves happy is to.string:
Another way to keep dwarves happy is to give them places to meet and hold social events.  Meeting halls work well for this purpose.  You can
drag out a meeting hall from a well or a table.  Note that a room dragged out from a table will be a dining room unless you specifically designate it a
meeting hall.

You can also drag out rooms from statues.string:
You can also drag out rooms from statues, cages and chains.  This will create sculpture gardens or zoos, respectively.  You can assign
these rooms to specific dwarves, or you can leave them as general meeting places.

Using querns to mill wheat and buckets t.string: Using querns to mill wheat and buckets to haul water is very inefficient, and your dwarves get tired of running on screw pump casings.  Fortunately you can utilize wind and water power to make these jobs easier.

You must connect power sources to work a.string: You must connect power sources to work areas.  In this case, the power sources are water wheels and windmills, and the work areas are millstones and screw pumps.

You can either place the work area direc.string: You can either place the work area directly adjacent to the power source, or you can use a series of axles and gear assemblies to transfer the power over longer distances.

An axle can only transfer power along it.string: An axle can only transfer power along its length.  A gear assembly can transfer power in any direction but uses more power per tile than an axle.  So if you want to connect a north/south axle to an east/west or an up/down axle, you must use a gear assembly (or a work area).

You require a visibly flowing body of wa.string: You require a visibly flowing body of water.  A temporary flood of water will also work for as long as you can sustain it.  To harness the power of the flow, you need to use a water wheel.  One you've got your machinery connected to the bank above the water, place a wheel directly above the flow.

A water wheel can only be connected to m.string: A water wheel can only be connected to machinery through its center perpendicular to the line of the wheel.  You need to use a gear assembly to transfer the power vertically.

A windmill can be placed anywhere outsid.string: A windmill can be placed anywhere outside.  It can only transfer power downward however, so you should build it on top of a gear assembly or work area, or you won't be able to use it.  In order to build it in the air, you might need to build temporary stairways, ramps or walls to access the location.

A windmill generates power according to.string: A windmill generates power according to the wind speed, which can vary with the time of day and other factors.

You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for h.string: You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for help.  Press it now for help on how to use this text viewer.  As of January 2021, you can also find help at the DF Wiki at dwarffortresswiki.org.  And remember:

An activity zone is an area where your d.string: An activity zone is an area where your dwarves perform any of a variety of tasks.  Sometimes the dwarves will perform these tasks on their own and the activity zone is a way of localizing activity, and sometimes the activity zone is the only way to get the dwarves to perform the task.

First you need to place an activity zone.string:
First you need to place an activity zone.  This is done by selecting two of its opposing corners with your cursor.
As you move to the second corner, you will be shown a count of how many of the squares in the rectangle are valid for a given activity.

Dwarves will use these zones for drinkin.string: Dwarves will use these zones for drinking, filling waterskins and filling buckets.  Dwarves will not drink saltwater and they don't like stagnant water.

Dwarves will use these areas for fishing.string: Dwarves will use these areas for fishing provided there are still fish to catch.

Dwarves will dump designated items in th.string: Dwarves will dump designated items in these squares.  A dumped item will become forbidden.  Dwarves will preferentially use open squares that cause the item to fall at least one level.

You can drop creatures into these zones..string: You can drop creatures into these zones.  You can also designate them to be filled with buckets.  Once an animal is dropped, it loses its attachment to the zone, so if it gets out somehow your dwarves will not seek to replace it.

You can collect sand in bags in these zo.string: You can collect sand in bags in these zones.  There must be sand in the zone for this to work.

Your dwarves will congregate in these ar.string: Your dwarves will congregate in these areas.

This menu allows you to look inside buil.string: This menu allows you to look inside buildings.  A cursor will appear on the screen.  Use [IKEY:CURSOR_UP][IKEY:CURSOR_DOWN][IKEY:CURSOR_LEFT][IKEY:CURSOR_RIGHT][IKEY:CURSOR_UPLEFT][IKEY:CURSOR_UPRIGHT][IKEY:CURSOR_DOWNLEFT][IKEY:CURSOR_DOWNRIGHT] to move the cursor.

The contents of the closest building are.string:
The contents of the closest building are displayed, along with instructions on how to select items.  You can view items from this menu, and you can
order the removal of the building.  You can also view the progress of building construction from this menu.

Depending on the building, some special.string: Depending on the building, some special symbols can appear to give you more information.

[C:3:0:1]TSK[C:7:0:0] A task is associat.string: [C:3:0:1]TSK[C:7:0:0] A task is associated to this object.[R]

[C:7:0:1][[B]][C:7:0:0] The object is pa.string: [C:7:0:1][[B]][C:7:0:0] The object is part of the building.[R]

[C:6:0:1][[T]][C:7:0:0] The object is a.string: [C:6:0:1][[T]][C:7:0:0] The object is a trade good.[R]

[C:2:0:1][[A]][C:7:0:0] This is an anima.string: [C:2:0:1][[A]][C:7:0:0] This is an animal caught in a trap.[R]

[C:6:0:0][[B]][C:7:0:0] This object is b.string: [C:6:0:0][[B]][C:7:0:0] This object is bait in a trap.[R]

[C:5:0:1][[L]][C:7:0:0] This object is l.string: [C:5:0:1][[L]][C:7:0:0] This object is loaded in a siege engine.[R]

[C:0:0:1][[B]][C:7:0:0] The object is en.string: [C:0:0:1][[B]][C:7:0:0] The object is enclosed in a coffin.[R]

[C:1:0:1][[B]][C:7:0:0] The object is as.string: [C:1:0:1][[B]][C:7:0:0] The object is associated to the building in another way.[R]

If the building is cluttered, that infor.string: If the building is cluttered, that information will be displayed at the top right of the menu.

Here you can set up tasks at buildings,.string: Here you can set up tasks at buildings, create rooms and set other building properties.  You can also designate buildings for destruction here.

Most buildings, including workshops, use.string:
Most buildings, including workshops, use a standard menu.  Here you can create tasks, set their priority, cancel them,
or set them to repeat.  Any healthy unoccupied dwarf with the proper professions will perform these tasks.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to an animal trap.

Animal traps catch small animals. In or.string:
Animal traps catch small animals.  In order for them to be effective, bait must be used.  The type of bait determines the possible captive.
Do not use gems.

Captured animals can be used for food, e.string: Captured animals can be used for food, extracts or trade. Some can be tamed.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a trade depot.

If merchants are coming, you can bring g.string: If merchants are coming, you can bring goods to the trade depot.

If merchants have arrived and unloaded t.string: If merchants have arrived and unloaded their goods, you can trade with them provided your broker or another dwarf is present at the depot with a trade job.

When trading, you select goods on both s.string:
When trading, you select goods on both sides of the partition.  Then you can trade.
The merchant will give you feedback and make a counter offer if possible.

You can seize goods from a merchant. Th.string: You can seize goods from a merchant.  This will cause tensions between your civilizations.

You can offer goods to a merchant. This.string: You can offer goods to a merchant.  This will smooth over tensions somewhat and generally improve relations.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a door.

You can set a door as forbidden. This w.string: You can set a door as forbidden.  This will stop your dwarves from passing through it during their regular activities.

You can set a door to be kept tightly cl.string: You can set a door to be kept tightly closed.  This means that your pets cannot use the door freely.

A door can also be set as internal. Thi.string: A door can also be set as internal.  This means that the door will not stop the room plan from flowing through during room creation.

Doors can be taken by invaders. This st.string: Doors can be taken by invaders.  This stops you from controlling the door.  To retake a door, one of your dwarves must walk through it.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a farm plot.

Here you can select which crop to plant.string:
Here you can select which crop to plant in the farm plot each season.
There is no reason to let a field stand fallow at the present time.
Prepare multiple plots to plant more than one crop type per season.

If a crop is red, it is known that this.string: If a crop is red, it is known that this is a bad time of the season to plant it.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a lever (or pressure plate).

The lever menu is a standard menu, but t.string:
The lever menu is a standard menu, but the tasks are unusual.  The lever (or pressure plate) can be linked to one or
more buildings.  Pulling the lever (or stepping on the pressure plate) causes the effect to be trigger.  Linking a
building requires two mechanisms and takes some time.

If accounts are active, press [IKEY:D_BU.string: If accounts are active, press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a shop.

Shops are run by their shopkeeper. You.string:
Shops are run by their shopkeeper.  You do not have any control over what happens here, but you
can view the status of the shop here.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a siege engine.

You can orient a siege engine and set it.string:
You can orient a siege engine and set its firing state.  Siege engines require ammunition.  Ballistas require specially constructed arrows.
Any stone will work in a catapult.

Siege engines work best against large ar.string:
Siege engines work best against large armies since the firing is imprecise, although having a ballista set to
fire down a hallway is an option that can provide some relief from invading forces that enter your fortress.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to a stockpile.

Here you can customize stockpile setting.string: Here you can customize stockpile settings.

You can make one pile want items from an.string:
You can make one pile want items from another pile.
Once you select "take from a pile", move to another pile and press [IKEY:SELECT].
You'll see the second pile appear in a list.

Here you have a list of the civilization.string:
Here you have a list of the civilizations.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Depending on the number of civilizations.string:
Depending on the number of civilizations you've located, there will be two columns of [C:2:1:1]P[C:7:0:0]s and [C:6:4:1]W[C:7:0:0]s.
The first column indicates the state of peace/war with your civilization, and the second relates the currently selected civilization to
the other civilizations.

When you are viewing a specific civiliza.string: When you are viewing a specific civilization, you can see that civilization's important figures, trade statistics and agreements.

Here you can designate areas for digging.string: Here you can designate areas for digging, detailing, plant gathering and wood cutting, among other things.

Use the displayed keys to select which t.string: Use the displayed keys to select which type of activity you are designating.

Press [IKEY:SELECT] to place one corner.string:
Press [IKEY:SELECT] to place one corner of the area you are designating.  All designated areas are rectangles.
Move the cursor and press [IKEY:SELECT] again to finish the designation.

If your designated area has encompassed.string:
If your designated area has encompassed any appropriate map squares, they will become highlighted.  Detail
highlighting is not always visible, but you can view it whenever you are designating.  Dig, chop and gather detailing
is always visible.

Removing designations works in the same.string:
Removing designations works in the same way as assigning them.  Any highlighted designations that are encompassed by
your rectangle will be removed.  This includes any active jobs.

A few things to keep in mind: You must.string: A few things to keep in mind:  You must connect a down staircase to an upward staircase in the level below.  If you select a floor as a channel, your dwarf will dig out the wall below as well.  Regular mining leaves a floor layer betwen adjacent levels.

Any rock wall or floor can be smoothed..string: Any rock wall or floor can be smoothed.  Smoothing increases the value of rooms, which makes the dwarves happier and attracts more dwarves to your fortress.  You can subsequently make engravings in the smooth surface to increase the value further.

Any detailed wall that is open on opposi.string:
Any detailed wall that is open on opposing sides (up/down or left/right) can be turned into a fortification.  Fortifications have no
monetary value, as opposed to normal detailed walls.  However, dwarves can fire through fortifications.  If you have dwarves equipped
with crossbows, they can be positioned safely behind fortifications, which still act as walls.

In addition, units cannot fire through f.string: In addition, units cannot fire through fortifications from a distance unless they make a skill roll, so you dwarves can fire safely through them even at enemy ranged units.

Use these designations to stop a dwarf f.string: Use these designations to stop a dwarf from using an item or to reclaim an item that has been forbidden.  When you send an expedition to reclaim an old fortress, all of the items there will start out forbidden.

You can remove constructions (such as wa.string: You can remove constructions (such as wall and floor sections you've made from blocks) using the Remove Construction designations.  You cannot mine or make engravings on these sections.

You can set traffic areas to bias the mo.string: You can set traffic areas to bias the movement of your dwarves.  Dwarves will prefer to walk through high traffic areas.  Normal traffic areas are not displayed.  A restricted traffic area does not prevent pathing, but dwarves will seldom use restricted areas if there is another way to get to their goal.

Press [IKEY:D_JOBLIST] or press [IKEY:D_.string:
Press [IKEY:D_JOBLIST] or press [IKEY:D_UNITLIST] from the main view.  The first emphasizes jobs and the
second emphasizes units.

This screen is a convenient way to few w.string:
This screen is a convenient way to few which tasks are active in the fortress and what your dwarves are doing.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

You can view the particulars of the job.string: You can view the particulars of the job or unit profiles from this screen.

You can also zoom to units or related bu.string: You can also zoom to units or related buildings, or remove a unit from certain jobs.

If you have a manager, you can access th.string: If you have a manager, you can access the manager screen from here.

Once you enter look mode, you'll have th.string: Once you enter look mode, you'll have the standard cursor to move around, and anything in the cursor's square will be listed on the right.

If you highlight a unit or item on the r.string: If you highlight a unit or item on the right and press [IKEY:SELECT], you will be taken to the unit profile or item descriptions, respectively.

First you'll be confronted by a long lis.string: First you'll be confronted by a long list of buildings.  Many of these lead to submenus.  Choose the building you want by pressing the displayed hotkey or by selecting it with the cursor.

If you don't have the required materials.string: If you don't have the required materials, you will be told what you need.

Once you are ready to place a building,.string:
Once you are ready to place a building, you'll see one or many Xs appear on the screen.  You can maneuver these in the same way as the standard cursor.
This is the location of your new building.  Some buildings have additional options for sizing and orientation.

The color of the Xs lets you know about.string: The color of the Xs lets you know about the building placement:

[C:2:0:0]X[C:7:0:0] Legal placement and.string: [C:2:0:0]X[C:7:0:0] Legal placement and will obstruct dwarves[R]

The [C:4:0:1]X[C:7:0:0] can also appear.string: The [C:4:0:1]X[C:7:0:0] can also appear in other special cases.  The reasons for placement failure are listed for you.

Once a building is placed, you'll be abl.string:
Once a building is placed, you'll be able to choose the objects you want to use from a list.  Some buildings require multiple items.
And of these, some buildings like bridges can be sized according to how many objects you select.  Other buildings like dirt roads do not require items.

When you've finished selecting items, he.string:
When you've finished selecting items, healthy unoccupied dwarves with the appropriate professions will get to work on it.  Some buildings require an architect
to design them.  Some require a carpenter or mason, while others require a dwarf of the profession used by the building's tasks.

If you have a manager, press [IKEY:D_JOB.string: Якщо ви маєте менеджера, натисніть [IKEY:D_JOBLIST] або [IKEY:D_UNITLIST] на головному екрані. Далі натисніть

You can set up work orders from this scr.string: You can set up work orders from this screen.  Work orders are a convenient way to set up tasks once your fortress starts getting large.

Press [IKEY:MANAGER_NEW_ORDER] to set up.string: Press [IKEY:MANAGER_NEW_ORDER] to set up a new order.  You'll be faced with an enormous list of potential tasks.

Type a portion of the name of the task y.string:
Type a portion of the name of the task you are looking for to narrow down the list.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_LEFT][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_RIGHT][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Press [IKEY:SELECT] to select a task. Y.string: Press [IKEY:SELECT] to select a task.  You'll be prompted for a quantity.  Type in a number and press [IKEY:SELECT].

The new order will appear in your work o.string: The new order will appear in your work order list.  You can remove orders and change their priorities.

Every so often, the manager will assign.string: Every so often, the manager will assign tasks to buildings based on the work orders.

If accounts are active, you can view wag.string: If accounts are active, you can view wages from this screen.

These are the important figures in your.string:
These are the important figures in your fortress.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Press [IKEY:SELECT] to view a noble's pr.string: Press [IKEY:SELECT] to view a noble's profile.  You can get specifics about requirements, demands and mandates here.

You can also appoint dwarves for adminis.string: You can also appoint dwarves for administrative tasks and set bookkeeper precision.

On the right, you'll see three categorie.string: On the right, you'll see three categories, which will now be described.

Nobles have required rooms and furniture.string: Nobles have required rooms and furniture.  The color of [[REQUIREMENT]] refers to the state of the requirements:

[C:6:0:1][[REQUIREMENT]][C:7:0:0] At lea.string: [C:6:0:1][[REQUIREMENT]][C:7:0:0] At least one requirement is only partially met.[R]

[C:4:0:1][[REQUIREMENT]][C:7:0:0] At lea.string: [C:4:0:1][[REQUIREMENT]][C:7:0:0] At least one requirement is being completely ignored.[R]

Nobles can become angry or sad if their.string: Nobles can become angry or sad if their requirements are not met, but there are no formal legal repercussions.

Nobles occasionally demand additional fu.string: Nobles occasionally demand additional furnishings.  The color of [[DEMAND]] refers to the state of the demands:

[C:6:0:0][[DEMAND]][C:7:0:0] At least on.string: [C:6:0:0][[DEMAND]][C:7:0:0] At least one demand is not met, but you have time.[R]

[C:6:0:1][[DEMAND]][C:7:0:0] At least on.string: [C:6:0:1][[DEMAND]][C:7:0:0] At least one demand is running out of time.[R]

[C:4:0:1][[DEMAND]][C:7:0:0] At least on.string: [C:4:0:1][[DEMAND]][C:7:0:0] At least one demand failure is being noticed by the noble.[R]

Nobles can become angry or sad if their.string: Nobles can become angry or sad if their demands are not met, but there are no formal legal repercussions.

Nobles also have the power to make forma.string: Nobles also have the power to make formal legal mandates.  The color of [[MANDATE]] refers to the state of the mandates:

[C:7:0:1][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] All mandat.string: [C:7:0:1][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] All mandates are standing restrictions, like export mandates.[R]

[C:6:0:0][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] At least o.string: [C:6:0:0][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] At least one mandate is timed, but you have plenty left.[R]

[C:6:0:1][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] At least o.string: [C:6:0:1][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] At least one timed mandate is at least half-way to expiration.[R]

[C:4:0:1][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] At least o.string: [C:4:0:1][[MANDATE]][C:7:0:0] At least one timed mandate is about to expire.[R]

Here you'll find a number of options tha.string:
Here you'll find a number of options that govern the behavior of your dwarves.
The descriptions of each follow.

The game announces when jobs fail, unles.string:
The game announces when jobs fail, unless you don't want to hear about it.
Some of these announcements are important, while others are just incidental.
The default setting is good for most purposes, but if you find it intrusive, change it here.

If you'd like to temporarily stop your d.string: If you'd like to temporarily stop your dwarves from considering animal haul jobs, do it here.
If you'd like to temporarily stop your dwarves from considering food haul jobs, do it here.
If you'd like to temporarily stop your dwarves from considering furniture haul jobs, do it here.
If you'd like to temporarily stop your dwarves from considering burial haul jobs, do it here.

Here you can set refuse orders, with a f.string: Here you can set refuse orders, with a few categories.

This lets you stop certain items from be.string: This lets you stop certain items from being used by dwarves (such as items dropped by dying opponents).

If you'd like to temporarily stop your d.string: If you'd like to temporarily stop your dwarves from considering stone and ore haul jobs, do it here.
If you'd like to temporarily stop your dwarves from considering wood haul jobs, do it here.

By default, all dwarves help with the ha.string:
By default, all dwarves help with the harvest, even nobles.  This is to prevent the loss of food.  If you feel
you have the situation under control, you can set only your farmers to harvest.

By default, dwarves will put all meats i.string:
By default, dwarves will put all meats in a "meat barrel" and all plants in a "plant barrel", for example.  If
you'd like them to separate foods out more specifically, you can do that here.

Here you can set some of your workshops.string: Here you can set some of your workshops to be automated.

Here you can restrict drinking and fishi.string: Here you can restrict drinking and fishing to your activity zones.

Press [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] from the main vi.string:
Press [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] from the main view and move to the desired unit.
After that, press [IKEY:UNITVIEW_PRF] followed by [IKEY:UNITVIEW_PRF_PROF].

There are many pages. Scroll with [IKEY.string: There are many pages.  Scroll with [IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEUP].

Select a profession with [IKEY:SELECT]..string: Select a profession with [IKEY:SELECT].  A dwarf can have several professions.

Here you have a list of all of the build.string:
Here you have a list of all of the buildings in the fortress, starting with the proper rooms.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

On the right, there is a map of your for.string: On the right, there is a map of your fortress and the location of the room.

If you press [IKEY:CHANGETAB], and the r.string:
If you press [IKEY:CHANGETAB], and the room has an owner, you'll be presented with two evaluations of the room.
One of them is impartial.  The other is based on the perception of the owner.

If you use materials that\na dwarf prefe.string:
If you use materials that
a dwarf prefers, you can often save objects and building space when you are trying to meet requirements.

If a room is shared by a spouse, you'll.string:
If a room is shared by a spouse, you'll also be able to view the spouse's evaluation.  Note that it
might say "[[Name]] / Spouse" but you receive no spouse evaluation.  This means that the spouse is dead.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] from the main view and move to one of the buildings discussed below.

Many buildings allow you to create rooms.string:
Many buildings allow you to create rooms.  Many other buildings are "masterable" by a room.  For instance,
if you place a chest in a bedroom, that chest will be associated to that bedroom, and the occupant of the bedroom will use it for storage.

You create a room by selecting the appro.string:
You create a room by selecting the appropriate option from the menu, and then sizing the room.  You'll see flashing [C:3:0:1]X[C:7:0:0]s.
These are the floor plan of the room.

If you are making rooms for individual d.string:
If you are making rooms for individual dwarves to use, it is best for them to have wall/door/window boundaries,
and for them not to be shared with other rooms.

Several buildings can be used to create.string: Several buildings can be used to create rooms:

Use beds to create rooms for dwarves to.string:
Use beds to create rooms for dwarves to sleep in, or a barracks for soldiers to sleep in.  Beds that are not set as rooms are used
by homeless dwarves and for medical care.

Use tables to create dining rooms. Once.string:
Use tables to create dining rooms.  Once a dining room is created, you can designate it as a meeting hall.  Creating a number of meeting halls
as your fortress grows is a good way to get your dwarves to make new friends.  They will also organize parties in meeting halls.

Use chairs to create offices and throne.string: Use chairs to create offices and throne rooms.  Most dwarves won't need one, but certain nobles and administrators want them.

Place coffins for your dwarves to be bur.string:
Place coffins for your dwarves to be buried in.  If they are set on "general burial", any needy corpse will be placed in the coffin.  Certain nobles
require tombs to be buried in.  This is the room that you drag out, and then assign to the noble prior to death.  If a dwarf has a tomb, they will
keep their possessions after death and they'll be moved to the tomb.  Otherwise all possessions will revert to the fortress.

Wells can be made into meeting hall room.string: Wells can be made into meeting hall rooms.

Cages can be used either for Dwarven Jus.string: Cages can be used either for Dwarven Justice or for zoos.  Any cage or chain mastered by a cage or chain is joined to the corresponding zoo or dungeon.

The officer in charge of a criminal will.string: The officer in charge of a criminal will place prisoners in any free justice building.  You must designate creatures for a zoo on your own.

If you are using an appropriate cage, yo.string:
If you are using an appropriate cage, you can designate it as an aquarium.  It will then be filled with water by a free dwarf, and you can place
live aquatic creatures inside for the viewing pleasure of passersby.

Chains are as cages, except that cannot.string: Chains are as cages, except that cannot be made into aquariums and they can only have one occupant.

A statue can be made into a sculpture ga.string:
A statue can be made into a sculpture garden.  These can be kept public or assigned to dwarves for private use.  Any building mastered by
a sculpture garden gives bonuses to the art-appreciation assessments that dwarves make as they wander your fortress.

You need to create a room from an archer.string:
You need to create a room from an archery target to tell potential marksdwarves where to stand.  The room doesn't need to be large, but
they should stand a few squares away from the target.

You control your army by moving squads a.string: You control your army by moving squads around.  These squads are constructed in the military screen.

There are two ways to control squads fro.string: There are two ways to control squads from here:  move and kill orders.

Move a squad if you just want them to si.string: Move a squad if you just want them to sit someplace until opposition arrives.

Soldiers will not follow your orders if.string: Soldiers will not follow your orders if they are standing down, eating, drinking, sleeping or heavily injured.

From the status screen, you can get lots.string: From the status screen, you can get lots of information about your fortress, as well as make many important designations.

In the beginning, you'll see your food s.string:
In the beginning, you'll see your food stores and a population breakdown, as well as some options across the top.  When you appoint some
skilled administrative dwarves, you'll also get some additional information about your wealth and trade statistics.

The options at the top take you to addit.string:
The options at the top take you to additional status screens.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_LEFT] and [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_RIGHT] to move, and [IKEY:SELECT] to select.

Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view.string: Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Animals" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

This lists all of the animals in your fo.string:
This lists all of the animals in your fortress.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

You can make tame animals available as p.string: You can make tame animals available as pets here.  Some dwarves like to keep a certain type of animal as a pet.  You can view pet preferences in the unit profile.

If an animal is not somebody's pet, you.string: If an animal is not somebody's pet, you can also designate it to be slaughtered.  The slaughter occurs at the butcher's shop.

Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view.string: Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Currency" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

Here you can see the current count of ea.string: Here you can see the current count of each type of currency, and a broker recommendation of how much currency to keep around.

If you have a sheriff or captain of the.string: If you have a sheriff or captain of the guard, press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Justice" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

Here you can view a list of all of the f.string:
Here you can view a list of all of the fortress's criminals.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

At the top right, you can see a list of.string: At the top right, you can see a list of how many justice buildings you have.  These are cages and chains that have the justice status turned on.

For each criminal, you'll see a list of.string: For each criminal, you'll see a list of crimes, and possibly a sentence and an assigned officer.

Possible punishments include incarcerati.string: Possible punishments include incarceration in a justice building, being beaten or receiving a fixed number of strokes from the hammer.

Many crimes are committed by dwarves thr.string:
Many crimes are committed by dwarves throwing tantrums.  However, crimes can occur when you break a mandate.  When a mandate is broken, the
offended noble blames a related dwarf.  So if you fail to make metal goods, a metalsmith is charged with violation of a production order.  If you
export a prohibited item, the dwarf that brought it to the trade depot is charged.

Dwarven justice can be very harsh, espec.string:
Dwarven justice can be very harsh, especially if the offended noble has a high rank.  It is therefore very important to obey mandates given out
by the nobles, lest your prized metalsmith be subjected to five hammerstrikes.

Hammering is the ultimate form of dwarve.string:
Hammering is the ultimate form of dwarven punishment.  The criminal is brought to a justice chain by the Hammerer and restrained.
The location of the hammerstrikes is calculated by the Hammerer, determined by an ancient formula.  Dwarves do not gather and spectate at such events.

Given such a sentence, death is not unco.string:
Given such a sentence, death is not uncommon.  The Hammerer is not swayed by the
pleas of a friend or even his or her own spouse at the time of the punishment, although the Hammerer is not immune to later anguish and can sink into bitter depression.

Particularly egregious crimes are punish.string:
Particularly egregious crimes are punished by execution.  Typically, an execution is a sentence of 50 to 100 hammerstrikes.  If the condemned dwarf somehow
survives, no further punishment is carried out and the dwarf can rejoin society to the extent that they are able.

This is never known to have occurred..string: This is never known to have occurred.

Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view.string: Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Kitchen" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

Here you can set whether or not differen.string:
Here you can set whether or not different kinds of food are cooked or brewed.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Seeds are not cooked by default, but you.string: Seeds are not cooked by default, but you might find yourself cooking seeds if you have more than enough for farming.

If accounts are active, press [IKEY:D_ST.string: If accounts are active, press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Prices" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

Here you can view the relative prices of.string:
Here you can view the relative prices of objects.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Prices are displayed as a percentage. T.string:
Prices are displayed as a percentage.  These are originally set by the bookkeeper corresponding to item availability, but occasionally nobles
will tweak prices to make objects they like harder for peasants to buy.  Produce more of an object or material to make it cheaper.

If no prices are displayed for a given o.string: If no prices are displayed for a given object type, this means that the prices are all at standard levels, or the object is completely unavailable for purchase.

You can view an individual item's price.string: You can view an individual item's price by viewing its description (from the Stocks screen for instance).

If you have a bookkeeper, press [IKEY:D_.string: If you have a bookkeeper, press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Stocks" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

Here you can view every single object on.string:
Here you can view every single object on the map.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_LEFT][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_RIGHT][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

There are two modes. One compresses the.string:
There are two modes.  One compresses the item list for convenience, and one displays the items individually in a list.  When you are in
the individual list, you can view an object's description or zoom to its location on the map.

Numbers in brown with question marks ind.string: Numbers in brown with question marks indicate that your bookkeeper has not yet put in enough office time for you to be able to expand the corresponding item type into a list of individual items.  Brown numbers are also rounded according to your bookkeeping precision level.

Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view.string: Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] from the main view, scroll to "Stone" and press [IKEY:SELECT].

Here you can set whether or not the econ.string:
Here you can set whether or not the economically valuable stones are used by the mason and others for tasks that don't relate directly to their primary economic value.  For instance, limestone can be used in the production of steel, but if you select limestone here, you can use it to make a limestone throne or limestone trinkets.
Use [IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:STANDARDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Your dwarves use stockpiles to store all.string: Your dwarves use stockpiles to store all of your finished, intermediate and raw objects.

When you get to the stockpile menu, you'.string:
When you get to the stockpile menu, you'll be faced by several stockpile options.  Each of these stockpile
types holds different kinds of objects.

To place a stockpile, press [IKEY:SELECT.string:
To place a stockpile, press [IKEY:SELECT] to designate one corner, move the cursor, and press [IKEY:SELECT] again to finish.
Stockpiles are denoted by [C:0:0:1]=[C:7:0:0].  You can only have one type of stockpile per square, and they cannot be placed on buildings.

Once you create a stockpile, you can set.string: Once you create a stockpile, you can set it to take goods from another stockpile.

Some stockpiles merit a bit of discussio.string: Some stockpiles merit a bit of discussion.

This holds anything inedible that can ro.string:
This holds anything inedible that can rot, as well as tattered clothing, bones and shells.
It's important to get refuse above ground before it starts to stink and bother your dwarves.
You'll notice purple clouds in your cave if something is rotting indoors.

This holds live animals in cages, not bu.string: This holds live animals in cages, not butchered animals.  Meat goes to the food pile.

Press [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] from the main vi.string: Press [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] from the main view and move the cursor to a unit.

There are several options from this scre.string: There are several options from this screen.

Here you can see a creature's type, acti.string: Here you can see a creature's type, active job and skills.  Use [IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll the skill list.

These are objects in the creature's poss.string: These are objects in the creature's possession.  Use [IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.  Press [IKEY:SELECT] to view an item's description.

This is where you assign professions and.string: This is where you assign professions and work dogs.  You can also view a dwarf's profile here.

You can see the creature's body status h.string: You can see the creature's body status here.  As the creature becomes more injured, scrolling becomes available.  Use [IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_DOWN][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_UP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEUP][IKEY:SECONDSCROLL_PAGEDOWN] to scroll.

Creatures do not have a \"life rating\",.string: Creatures do not have a "life rating", although they can bleed to death.  Small creatures have difficulty injuring larger creatures.

Parts that are broken cannot be used to.string:
Parts that are broken cannot be used to stand on the ground or to hold objects.  A dwarf with such an injury should be allowed to rest or ideally should receive medical treatment.
Severe injuries to the spine or brain cause paralysis and they do not heal.  Missing parts do not grow back.

If accounts are active, press [IKEY:D_JO.string:
If accounts are active, press [IKEY:D_JOBLIST] or press [IKEY:D_UNITLIST] from the main view.  Then press
[IKEY:UNITJOB_MANAGER] and finally [IKEY:MANAGER_WAGES].

You can view wages from this screen..string: You can view wages from this screen.

The percentages on the first screen are.string:
The percentages on the first screen are general guild modifiers.  These are not applied to the wage numbers in subsequent screens.
So if mining is displayed as "[C:3:0:1]5[CHAR:15][C:7:0:0]" and the mining modifier is set at "[C:3:0:1]200%[C:7:0:0]", mining is actually worth [C:3:0:1]10[CHAR:15][C:7:0:0].

Starting from the main dwarf fortress sc.string:
Starting from the main dwarf fortress screen, there are many options, and it can
be difficult to sort things out at first.  Here each choice will be described.

[IKEY:CURSOR_UPLEFT][IKEY:CURSOR_UPRIGHT.string: [IKEY:CURSOR_UPLEFT][IKEY:CURSOR_UPRIGHT][IKEY:CURSOR_DOWNLEFT][IKEY:CURSOR_DOWNRIGHT][IKEY:CURSOR_UP_Z][IKEY:CURSOR_DOWN_Z] to move the view window around.

Use [IKEY:CHANGETAB] to cycle through di.string: Use [IKEY:CHANGETAB] to cycle through different arrangements of the view windows.

Keep in mind that you can pause the game.string:
Keep in mind that you can pause the game at any time using [IKEY:D_PAUSE].  If you want to step through
the game Very slowly, use [IKEY:D_ONESTEP].  It takes about ten presses of this key for the average dwarf to move one square,
but it lets you watch battles very precisely if you like.

If you ever get lost as you scroll aroun.string: If you ever get lost as you scroll around, press [IKEY:D_HOTKEY1].  This key zooms you to your starting wagon.  You can change the zoom hotkeys by pressing [IKEY:D_HOT_KEYS].

Every announcement made at the bottom of.string: Every announcement made at the bottom of the screen is saved for you.  Press [IKEY:D_ANNOUNCE] to view them.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDING] to place a build.string:
Press [IKEY:D_BUILDING] to place a building.  Most buildings require some kind of material and a dwarf
with the proper profession settings to build them.  Note that many buildings first need to be designed
by a dwarf with the Architecture profession.  Follow the link for more information.

Press [IKEY:D_DESIGNATE] to designate ar.string:
Press [IKEY:D_DESIGNATE] to designate areas for digging, detailing, plant gathering and wood cutting.
If a dwarf has the appropriate profession and equipment, work will begin immediately.

Press [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] to view unit inf.string:
Press [IKEY:D_VIEWUNIT] to view unit information.  Move the cursor to a unit and you'll see a menu.
This is where you set professions, view thoughts and wounds, view skills and set soldier preferences,
among other things.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] to view the task.string:
Press [IKEY:D_BUILDJOB] to view the task lists for your buildings.  You also create rooms and set
some other settings using the menus that arise from this selection.

Press [IKEY:D_BUILDITEM] to view the obj.string:
Press [IKEY:D_BUILDITEM] to view the objects that are in a building.  You'll often find objects
you thought were missing inside a building.

Press [IKEY:D_CIVZONE] to create a new a.string: Press [IKEY:D_CIVZONE] to create a new activity zone.

Press [IKEY:D_STOCKPILES] to create a ne.string: Press [IKEY:D_STOCKPILES] to create a new stockpile.

Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] to view the overal.string:
Press [IKEY:D_STATUS] to view the overall status of your fortress.  You can check your population and
your food stores.  At first you can also get advice and set preferences for your kitchens and animals.
Later on several additional menus open up as you attract specialized dwarves.

Press [IKEY:D_ORDERS] to set the standin.string: Press [IKEY:D_ORDERS] to set the standing orders for your dwarves.  Follow the link for descriptions.

Press [IKEY:D_ROOMS] to view the list of.string:
Press [IKEY:D_ROOMS] to view the list of rooms and buildings.  You can also check
how a dwarf values a room from here.

Press [IKEY:D_JOBLIST] to view a list of.string:
Press [IKEY:D_JOBLIST] to view a list of jobs.  This is similar to the Unit List screen.  If you have a manager,
you can get to the manager screen from here.

Press [IKEY:D_UNITLIST] to view a list o.string:
Press [IKEY:D_UNITLIST] to view a list of units.  This is similar to the Job List screen.  If you have a manager,
you can get to the manager screen from here.

Press [IKEY:D_MILITARY] to view and chan.string:
Press [IKEY:D_MILITARY] to view and change your military.  You can access the menus of individual squads and set the
chain of command from this screen.

Press [IKEY:D_SQUADS] to order your squa.string: Press [IKEY:D_SQUADS] to order your squads to station at a new location or to send them on patrols.

Press [IKEY:D_LOOK] to look at everythin.string: Press [IKEY:D_LOOK] to look at everything that is in a map square.  You can select many of these objects for further descriptions.

Press [IKEY:D_NOBLES] to view your noble.string: Press [IKEY:D_NOBLES] to view your nobles and appoint administrators.

Mining is the most basic activity your d.string: Mining is the most basic activity your dwarves will perform.  In order to mine, you need the following:

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, u.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A healthy, unoccupied dwarf with a pick and the Mining profession

[C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A rock wall.string: [C:6:0:1][CHAR:15][C:2:0:1] A rock wall in a designated mining area that such a dwarf can access

Mining serves two purposes. First, you.string:
Mining serves two purposes.  First, you get minerals which you can turn into treasure.  Second, you
create living space for your dwarves to shelter in.  The rest of the First Outpost tutorial
will guide you through how to create living spaces, how to make crafts and how to store the minerals
and crafts that come under your control.

When you start your first game, you'll n.string:
When you start your first game, you'll notice that it goes through a lengthy world generation process.
You only have to do this once in a long while, so sit back and enjoy it.

At first, the game produces\nseveral fra.string:
At first, the game produces
several fractally generated landscapes, searching for an ideal balance.  You'll notice that there are
many rejects, sometimes well over one hundred.  This is normal -- you'll be playing several fortresses
in this world, so it's important that terrain is evenly distributed.

After the basic terrain is prepared,\nth.string:
After the basic terrain is prepared,
the game will simulate erosion and run rivers and lakes.  It's still possible to have a few rejects at this point.

Once the history animation begins, you a.string:
Once the history animation begins, you are indeed watching the world you'll be playing in.  The civilizations
that are spreading out and fighting over the ages will be the same ones you interact with when you are running a fortress.

When history catches up with the present.string: When history catches up with the present time, the animated world map becomes a piece of parchment and you are prompted to continue.

When you start, your dwarves will be loc.string: When you start, your dwarves will be located in the environment you selected with whatever animals and objects you decided to bring along.  If you've brought along somebody that knows how to fish or hunt, that dwarf will get to work, but the others will mill around, awaiting your orders.

Your ultimate goal is to extract every l.string: Your ultimate goal is to extract every last ounce of wealth from the mountain, but first you need to survive, so you need to get your dwarves to handle the basics.  Most orders are issued to your dwarves from buildings you've created, and others are issued by designating work areas.

The list of options can be daunting at f.string: The list of options can be daunting at first (and will remain daunting for a while).  Read the following sections to get a handle on individual aspects of running a simple fortress.

You have successfully navigated a text l.string: You have successfully navigated a text link!

[B]Press [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN] to go back t.string: [B]Press [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN] to go back to the previous screen.

Welcome to Dwarf Fortress. Your old for.string:
Welcome to Dwarf Fortress.  Your old fortress.  Things didn't go well, and now you're back to set the record straight or die trying.
I wonder which it will be.  In any case, the game runs in the same way, except there is a pre-carved and pre-populated outpost
waiting for you.

You'll notice that your dwarves do not i.string:
You'll notice that your dwarves do not interact with the objects in the fortress at first.  This is to prevent accidents.
The last thing you want is for your dwarves to run alone to fetch something deep in enemy territory.

In order to let your dwarves know where.string:
In order to let your dwarves know where to go, use the Claim designation.  When you select it, you'll notice that many of
the items on the screen turn green.  These are objects which are currently being ignored.  They'll also be surrounded by {}.

You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for h.string:
You can press [IKEY:HELP] any time for help.  Press it now for help on how to use this text viewer.
And remember:

[C:2:0:1]Last time you lost it was fun,.string: [C:2:0:1]Last time you lost it was fun, and it'll be fun this time too![C:7:0:0]

Now that the world has been generated, i.string:
Now that the world has been generated, it's time to prepare your settlers to travel.  There are three main screens.
Instructions for which keys to press are displayed at the bottom of each screen.

The Site Selection Screen shows you wher.string: The Site Selection Screen shows you where your fortress is located, and the general characteristics of the surrounding area.  You can place your fortress in any location so long as the selection rectangle isn't entirely in an ocean, lake or mountain biome.

The Unit Preparation Screen has a list o.string:
The Unit Preparation Screen has a list of the dwarves that are going on the journey and their skills.
Dwarves learn as they work, so it's not essential to spend a lot of points here, but you might find it convenient to
let them know what their main roles are at this point by making them novices in a few skills.  For instance, if you make
one of the dwarves a "Novice Miner", then that dwarf will immediately grab a pick and take any mining orders you prepare.

You buy skills with points. Keep in min.string:
You buy skills with points.  Keep in mind that the skill list scrolls.
The amount of points you have is displayed on the lower right.
These points are also used to buy equipment on the Equipment Preparation Screen.

The Equipment Preparation Screen is the.string:
The Equipment Preparation Screen is the most complicated of the three screens.  The list of objects your dwarves are bringing along appears on the left, and the list of animals going on the journey appears on the right.  If you choose to add a new object, you'll be taken to a screen with a list of all the potential items that you can bring.  Type in a partial name to narrow the list.
You can leave this screen by selecting an object or by pressing [IKEY:LEAVESCREEN].

If you aren't careful, your fortress can.string:
If you aren't careful, your fortress can become a cluttered and inefficient mess.
In fact, you'll find one of your principal roles in managing the fortress is to get food, materials and finished goods to
move around efficiently.

The main method for moving objects aroun.string:
The main method for moving objects around is the designation of stockpiles.  A stockpile has certain object types associated to it,
and any object that isn't already stored will be brought to a free space in the pile when a dwarf with the proper hauling profession
has some free time.

Using the mastery option, you can make p.string:
Using the mastery option, you can make piles take objects from other piles to create a flow of goods throughout
the fortress.

Stockpiles fill up quickly. In order to.string: Stockpiles fill up quickly.  In order to consolidate objects and save space, dwarves use bins.

Once you make a bin, the dwarves will mo.string: Once you make a bin, the dwarves will move it to a furniture stockpile.  The next time a bin is needed, a dwarf will place an object in the bin, and then the bin will be moved to the proper stockpile.  All you have to do is provide a consistent supply of bins.

Barrels are exactly like bins, but they.string: Barrels are exactly like bins, but they are used for food.  Food in barrels is less susceptible to pests, though barrels are not immune to their clever and persistent vermin natures.

Dwarves will amass personal property ove.string: Dwarves will amass personal property over time, especially when the coin economy begins in the middle game.  If a dwarf has a room, you'll soon find that personal possessions cover the floor.  In order to give the dwarf more storage space, consider placing a chest and a cabinet within the room.  Cabinets are used for storing clothes, and chests are used to store everything else.  Certain important dwarves will require weapon and armor racks in their rooms as well.
